titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 438) to promote and enhance public safety through use of 911 as the universal emergency assistance number, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-27, by Mr. Linder.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 438 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Points of order against consideration of the bill for failure to comply with clause 4(a) of rule XIII are waived. After general debate the bill shall be considered for amendment under the five-minute rule. Measure will be read by section. Bill is open to amendments. It shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Commerce now printed in the bill. The Chairman of the Committee my accord priority in recognition on the basis of whether the Member offering the amendment caused it to be printed in the Congressional Record.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 11.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 2/23/1999--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (open) for the consideration of H.R. 438 (universal emergency assistance number).
